snippet: Energy stocks dropped while consumer discretionary shares rose on the assumption that people will put more cash into nonessential products and services.
abstract: Anna Bernasek Datapoints column observes consumer discretionary stocks have been buoyed by decline in oil prices, as consumers have more money to spend after saving at pump; observes stocks could nonetheless fall out of favor as consumers decline to spend their windfall.
lead_paragraph: Energy stocks dropped while consumer discretionary shares rose on the assumption that people will put more cash into nonessential products and services.

headline.print_headline: Consumers Thrive as Oil Shares Dive
headline.main: Consumers Thrive as Oil Shares Dive
